About Me

Hi, I’m Brenda :). I am in my final year at SF State, working torwards my bachelors degree in computer science. I’ve worked on several projects in my coursework where I developed a keen interest in Agile development and managing projects to completion.

Currently seeking internships and full-time opportunities in project management for Summer 2024!

10/2022 - 03/2023
Academic Technology @ SFSU

The team works closely with a systems team in an on-premise private cloud environment. Candidates would work within a professional development team of software developers, quality assurance testers, and application administrators who execute projects in close collaboration.

Advocacy and Recruitment Liason

08/2022 - 08/2023
Computing Alliance of Hispanic-Serving @ SFSU

CAHSI advocates program serves to engage student leaders to serve as advocates for the computer science community. Advocates gain a netowrk of other students leaders that are fostering communnities around them. Latino advocacy reminds us of the importance of different cultures and societal gaps. Diversity is a strength that enriches society.

  • Hosted workshops on diversity and inclusion for computer science (CS) students
  • Founded and delivered “Encouraging Diversty in Tech”, a biweekly newsletter to disseminate job opportunities and resources to CS students
  • Partnered with other diversity organizations to develop a professional support network

Orientation Leader

04/2022 - 08/2022
New Student & Family Program @ SFSU

Orientation Leaders (OLs) assist with the implementation of San Francisco State University’s New Student & Family Orientation Program (NSFP). OLs are current students who are well-respected, academically balanced leaders on campus.

  • Succesfully prepared over 30 orientation sessions: scheduling, documentation, and staffing/logistics.
  • Mentored newly admitted students through orientation, connecting them with academic resources and student life at SFSU.
  • Hosted campus tours for several hundred students and guided them through course selection and enrollment.

Summer Web Dev Program Participant

04/2022 - 08/2022
Microsoft, Seattle (Remote)

During this 8 week mentorship program, groups of 3 undergraduate students are paired with a full-time Microsoft employee develop a web application of their choice. We built a simple Django application to be used by any social organization on the SFSU campus. Key features included the ability to create posts and user/database management.
